alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 27 at 7:57PM CDT until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pascagoula River At Graham Ferry affecting Jackson County. For the Pascagoula River...including Graham Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pascagoula River At Graham Ferry. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, River property at Cumbest Bluff will be cut off by high water and some river roads will be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 16.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 03/19/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
